syllabus:
**I.**  **Goal:**

The ultimate goal of this course is to discuss with students some important issues in first language a  cquisition. By the end of the term, students are supposed to provide empirical arguments to support what they learn in class.

**II. Requirements:**

1.  several oral presentations

2.  several quizzes

3.  a term paper

4.  Grading Policy:

    (1) Quizzes ----------------------------------------------------------------------  20%

    (2) Paper  ------------------------------------------------------------------------ 50%

    (3) Oral Presentations ----------------------------------------------------------- 30%

**III. Tentative Schedule:**

methodologies.note: T will elaborate further on the concepts presented by Ss, when necessary.
T and Ss will explore the issues related to different issues in first language acquisition.
T will assign Ss to present given book chapters and journal papers individually and in pairs.
T will guide Ss to work on their research design for their empirical study due by the end of the semester.
T will ask Ss to do oral presentations with PowerPoint files and videos.
T will discuss with each student about his/her term paper.

grading.note: A term paper is due by the end of the semester.
